CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 25, 1954, pg. 1 reads: "Sewing For Santa - Many a little girls' heart in Africa were made happier on Christmas because Mrs. Mary Gilliam, 2642 Wylie Avenue, dressed dolls for them herself. Mrs. Gilliam is unable to get around like the average person but she is the type who want to see others, especially little children, happy.  She lives with a niece, Mrs. Harriet Washington, and is raising another niece, Miss Maxine Wilheimer. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Gilliam, seated at table with sewing machine making doll clothes for charity
